intro: Benthamantha, commonly known as the "southern bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plants typically grow as shrubs or herbs, with opposite, lanceolate leaves and often hairy stems. Benthamantha species are often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
